experiences.description: At Redweek.com, a website for timeshare rental and resale, I worked on the development of features and bug fixing in a full-stack fashion. My Role involved using a range of technologies, including Perl and PostgreSQL for the backend, and HTML, JavaScript with JQuery, and SASS for the frontend.

At Autodesk, I worked on the foundation team for the Maya project, a multi-language and multi-platform software used for animation creation in the games and film industry. During my time there, I gained extensive experience in C++, Python, and MEL, and developed a deep understanding of software development principles and best practices.

At Khomp, I worked on the development on embedded systems for the telephony industry, utilizing a wide range of programming languages, network protocols, and UNIX systems. I was responsible for developing solution for Khomp's servers, which required me to leverage my expertise in C++, Python and PHP, as well as testing frameworks like GTests and Catch.

At Camisas Tech, a small startup abroad, I was selected to lead a team of interns to develop a hybrid application using Ionic and Django. As the first software engineering intern, I played an integral role in organizing the team and establishing Agile development process.

Worked on Audaces Idea, a vector image creation software, written mostly in C++, using Agile techniques and Scrum. Participated in the migration of the frameworks and upgrades of the software structure, including moving from Borderland C++ to Visual Studio, VLC to Qt4, and removal of the PostgreSQL database to a file-based system.

Provided technical support for the international HSBC group, with more than 33 countries supported. Got recognition from my bosses in U.K. for the quality of the work that I was doing in a very short period of time.
Intern of the Trade software team, involved in development and testing on a waterfall software development environment.
Involved on the development of a software for electrial grid mapping for technicians on the field.
